subject: Law
title: What Is a Contract?
description: A quick, practical guide to What Is a Contract?.

hook.text: You agree to mow your neighbor's lawn for $50. Shake hands. That's a contractâ€”no paper needed.

buildup.text: A contract is a legally enforceable agreement between two or more parties that creates obligations.

discovery.text: It needs four elements: offer, acceptance, consideration, and mutual assent.

twist.text: Most contracts don't need to be written. Oral contracts are valid for many transactions.

climax.text: But proving an oral contract in court is much harder. Writing creates evidence of the deal.

punchline.text: A promise backed by law. That's a contract.

quiz.question: What four elements form a valid contract?
